snippet: The rules are designed to tackle origination fees, which vary widely depending on the amount of a loan.
abstract: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will propose tighter mortgage lending regulations that would limit the ability of banks and mortgage bankers to charge certain transaction fees, possibly ending one of the most abusive costs levied on consumers when they buy a house.
lead_paragraph: The rules are designed to tackle origination fees, which vary widely depending on the amount of a loan.

headline.seo: Consumer Agency to Propose Curbs on Origination Fees
headline.main: New Rules May Curtail Some Fees in Mortgage
headline.print_headline: New Rules May Curtail Some Fees In Mortgage
